column4: will migration-assistant allow you to pick and choose which directories to copy over when migrating from say xp to ubuntu 7.04?
#ubuntu+1 for Feisty questions
diff
ifconfig
Jordan_U thanks :)
Does it have openssh installed?
yes openssh is installed and the server is started
you're trying to connect through a router? or are they both on the same subnet?
but the router is set to forward to the ip of the machine in question
are you sure it's set to forward to the right machine?
Check out something like icecast, to stream audio
would icecast go on the serving machine or the remote one
It'd go on the server machine, and it would stream audio to any client listening.  There are a number of clients that can listen ot icecast, on all OSs
i don't suppose my favorite one exaile can though :(
What do you mean?  You're running exaile on the machine you're sitting at now?  Yeah, it can.
awesome!
so would i be able to choose files from a folder in icecast or something? I don't really see how this will work with exaile
Icecast just streams music that you give to it.  On the server, you'd run soemthing (mpd for instance) that will send music to icecast, which your local music player can listen to streaming
what controls what music is being sent to icecast though? id ideally like to be able to go through a music library like in exaile
You'd use something on the server (or the machine that sends the music to the server).  mpd has an ncurses client, and a php interface, and a few other options too.
lsb_release -a
cool, thanks
